messages: 9426c771da2e99890082a924fdc821d8 (10:11): Is the NetBSD Xen howto out-of-date? It references Xen 2.0, but I see that Xen 3.0 is now available
ce2a02cdaaee6dde37224039af86f431 (10:20): blake: well, first of, no netbsd release yet has xen 3.0 dom0 support
ce2a02cdaaee6dde37224039af86f431 (10:20): blake: and secondly, config is close to xen 2.0
ce2a02cdaaee6dde37224039af86f431 (10:20): blake: but see http://wiki.onetbsd.org/index.php/xen3-install:xen
ce2a02cdaaee6dde37224039af86f431 (10:21): netbsd 4 will have xen 3.0 dom0 support, however.
ce2a02cdaaee6dde37224039af86f431 (10:21): (and 3.1 will have xen 3.0 domU)
2ecd667d02e115bb15882f5ff12cd533 (10:29): is there a way to make startx use f5 like normal and make the virtual terminal that started the process logout and clear it's screen?
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (10:31): tekemperor: clear && exec startx
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (10:31): tekemperor: actually, it doesn't logout until you exit X, but you can't get a shell without login in anyway
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (10:32): maybe that instead: ( startx > /dev/null 2>&1 & ) && clear && exit
2ad13ffdb6e4e3bf432da1969a09890c (10:33): night all
2ecd667d02e115bb15882f5ff12cd533 (10:33): my problem is that if I go back to f2 (where I usually log in from) and hit ctl + c a lot, i can kill the xsession and get a prompt.
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (10:34): tekemperor: yeah, well, I gave you 2 solutions.
2ecd667d02e115bb15882f5ff12cd533 (10:34): The trouble with this now is that to test it I have to close this because I chose a graphical irc client
2ecd667d02e115bb15882f5ff12cd533 (10:34): thanks sphex.
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (10:34): tekemperor: you can start multiple X servers BTW
2ecd667d02e115bb15882f5ff12cd533 (10:40): startx -- :# doesn't seem to be going to the displays I tell it to.
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (10:40): you might to create that VT
2ecd667d02e115bb15882f5ff12cd533 (10:40): How do I do that?
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (10:41): tekemperor: what # did you tell it?
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (10:42): ok. you only get 5 VTs by default, #5 would be the 6th...
2ecd667d02e115bb15882f5ff12cd533 (10:42): f1 is zero isn't it?
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (10:42): yeah
2ecd667d02e115bb15882f5ff12cd533 (10:42): I only get 5?
2ecd667d02e115bb15882f5ff12cd533 (10:42): I want like 12.
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (10:43): I think that should create the 6th one: wsconscfg 6
2ecd667d02e115bb15882f5ff12cd533 (10:43): well I would really only use 6.
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (10:43): tekemperor: might want to take a look at screen(1) instead of using tons of VTs... :p
2ecd667d02e115bb15882f5ff12cd533 (10:44): sphex, screen can handle an xsession?
2ecd667d02e115bb15882f5ff12cd533 (10:44): I didn't know that.
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (10:45): it can't
2ecd667d02e115bb15882f5ff12cd533 (10:49): well running x in the background makes it take the VT that started it apparently.
2ecd667d02e115bb15882f5ff12cd533 (10:50): that actually solves my problem.
2ecd667d02e115bb15882f5ff12cd533 (10:53): thanks for the help.
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (10:54): maybe you need to give it the "vtXX" argument to choose the VT
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (10:54): tekemperor: np
ed5dd9d10388fc6e54cc32959e4c54ad (10:58): now i understand why the made X 7 modular..
2ecd667d02e115bb15882f5ff12cd533 (10:58): sphex would that be like "startx -- :ttyE5"?
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (10:59): tekemperor: I think startx -- vt05
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (11:01): afk
